definition: to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
to be in a thundering rage (idiom)

sentences.english: He cried, his blue eyes blazing angrily behind his spectacles.
sentences.chinese: 他咆哮着，眼鏡後的藍眼睛閃爍着熊熊怒火。

sentences.english: He raved like a wild beast .
sentences.chinese: 他象野獸般地咆哮起來。

sentences.english: They ranted and raved at the injustice of it all.
sentences.chinese: 他們不停的咆哮以抗議這事的不公。

sentences.english: A great dog scorns the snarling of a little dog .
sentences.chinese: 一隻大狗瞧不起一隻小狗的咆哮。

sentences.english: He growled at me and showed his teeth.
The monster flood had dulled its roar and retreated, but its impact would be long-lasting.
sentences.chinese: 洪魔已無力咆哮，開始撤退，但他的影響將持續下去。

sentences.english: The press conference ended up in a slanging match , each side shouting at the other.
sentences.chinese: 記者招待會最後變成謾罵比賽，雙方相對咆哮。

sentences.english: He bellows, rends the air with anguish.
sentences.chinese: 他咆哮着，痛苦的喊聲劃破長空。

sentences.english: And I see you've brought the mighty Hellscream.
sentences.chinese: 我也看到你將強大的地獄咆哮給帶來了。
對負面的咆哮方式說抱歉。

sentences.english: The radio was bellowing frightfully, and I thought the speaker's voice sounded familiar.
sentences.chinese: 收音機傳來可怕的咆哮聲，且我覺得那聲音聽來熟悉。

sentences.english: "Have you seen the duke's third daughter?" roared Mononoke.
sentences.chinese: “你見到過城主的三女兒嗎？”貓怪咆哮着。

sentences.english: A high wind blustered round the house, and roared in the chimney it sounded wild and stormy .
sentences.chinese: 大風繞屋咆哮，並在煙囪裏怒吼，聽起來狂暴猛烈。

sentences.english: It was five and a half o'clock now, and a raw, blustering morning.
sentences.chinese: 這時才五點半，正是寒氣逼人，狂風咆哮的早晨。

sentences.english: With snarls and a blur of motion THEY ATTACK.
sentences.chinese: 隨着咆哮聲和模糊的身影，他們發動了攻擊。

sentences.english: Suddenly the dog began growling again.
sentences.chinese: 突然，那條狗又咆哮起來。

definition: to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to be in a thundering rage (idiom)
to face upwards/to look up to the sky
to howl in grief/anguished wailing/same as 哀号
to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
